instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01814: What is 820-01814? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only boots in safe mode after liquid
threads.message:
Liquid damage near <CHIP>U7420</CHIP>. Board had a short prior to replacing <CHIP>U7420</CHIP>. Replaced and all seemed good. 
When booting it gets half way, the fans spin up fast and it restarts. In safe mode it boots fine. Attaching panic report. 
Same after restoring.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only boots in safe mode after liquid
threads.message:
Used <CHIP>U7420</CHIP> from 00928.. from the schematic I thought they were the same but the lettering on the chip is different.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - SIC532 BE
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - SIC535 AF

I used schematic for <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Which says SIC535.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only boots in safe mode after liquid
threads.message:
Possibly Intel Graphics issue.
Start with external monitor connected.
This will automatically enable Discrete GPU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only boots in safe mode after liquid
threads.message: Same result with external. Tried with internal connected and disconnected.

threads.message: So the type of chip doesnâ€™t matter 532 vs 535?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only boots in safe mode after liquid
threads.message:
You can try to get original chip, if possible.
But overvoltage through burnt <CHIP>U7420</CHIP> occurred for sure.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only boots in safe mode after liquid
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only boots in safe mode after liquid
threads.message:
Got some new original chips and still not working :( 
Moving on.
